result.execSummary:
The defendant Mairceon V Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with standard release conditions INCLUDING work and treatment.
Apply 18 days sentence credit.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 06-20-2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mairceon V Ray

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Mairceon V Ray did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden in unsure as defendant's whereabouts.   Case was set for 8:30, case was called at 9:05 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance, Court orders bail be revoked and forfieted.  Court issues capias.  The court removes the trial/jury status from its calendar.
Hearing on June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mairceon V Ray in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Menden is requesting an adjournment of the trial as the Defendant is in the process of applying for drug treatment court but there is a wait list until July.   The State does not object to the adjournment.  The Court grants the adjournment and reschedules the jury trial.   The Court addresses the positive WCS report.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 08:15 am.
